00036 class Zend_Validate_Regex extends Zend_Validate_Abstract
00037 {
00038     const INVALID   = 'regexInvalid';
00039     const NOT_MATCH = 'regexNotMatch';
00040 
00044     protected $_messageTemplates = array(
00045         self::INVALID   => "Invalid type given, value should be string, integer or float",
00046         self::NOT_MATCH => "'%value%' does not match against pattern '%pattern%'"
00047     );
00048 
00052     protected $_messageVariables = array(
00053         'pattern' => '_pattern'
00054     );

00061     protected $_pattern;
00062 
00069     public function __construct($pattern)
00070     {
00071         $this->setPattern($pattern);
00072     }

00079     public function getPattern()
00080     {
00081         return $this->_pattern;
00082     }
00083 
00090     public function setPattern($pattern)
00091     {
00092         $this->_pattern = (string) $pattern;
00093         return $this;
00094     }
00095 
00105     public function isValid($value)
00106     {
00107         if (!is_string($value) && !is_int($value) && !is_float($value)) {
00108             $this->_error(self::INVALID);
00109             return false;
00110         }
00111 
00112         $this->_setValue($value);
00113 
00114         $status = @preg_match($this->_pattern, $value);
00115         if (false === $status) {
00116             require_once 'Zend/Validate/Exception.php';
00117             throw new Zend_Validate_Exception("Internal error matching pattern '$this->_pattern' against value '$value'");
00118         }
00119         if (!$status) {
00120             $this->_error(self::NOT_MATCH);
00121             return false;
00122         }
00123         return true;
00124     }
